- 1 small pkg. peach jello
- 1 small pkg. apricot jello

Directions:
- Bring pineapple, water and sugar to a boil; remove from heat. Add jellos.
- Chill until partially set.
- Whip slightly before adding other ingredients.

Tangy Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (20 oz.) can pineapple chunks, juice drained and reserved
- 1 pkg. sugar-free instant vanilla pudding mix
- 1/4 c. sugar-free Tang
- 1 can mandarin oranges, drained
- 1 can light fruit cocktail, drained
- 2 bananas, sliced
- 1 apple, in small slices
- 1 c. blueberries (fresh or frozen)
- 1 c. sliced strawberries

Directions:
- In small bowl, combine reserved pineapple juice, pudding mix and Tang; set aside.
- In large bowl, combine all the fruit.
- Fold juice mixture into fruit.
- Refrigerate before serving.

Cornbread Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. cornbread, cooked and crumbled
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 c. onion, cut fine
- 3/4 c. celery, cut fine
- 3/4 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. tomatoes, cut up (optional)

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients in large bowl.
- Refrigerate overnight.

Tomato Salad In A Bread Bowl

Ingredients:
- 1 large round crusty peasant bread
- 1 large cucumber, peeled
- 8 large plum tomatoes, cut in 8 pieces
- 1 yellow pepper, diced
- 1 c. black olives, chopped
- 1/2 c. thinly sliced onion
- 1 tsp. freshly minced garlic
- 1 c. basil leaves, washed and slivered
- coarse salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 c. extra virgin olive oil
- 2 Tbsp. red wine vinegar

Directions:
- Cut a thin slice off top of bread.
- Carefully cut out most of the inside of the bread, leaving a shell.
- Tear insides into large, irregular pieces.
- Toss lightly under broiler.
- Set aside.

Frog Eye Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 3/4 c. pineapple juice
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 1/2 tsp. lemon juice
- 2 qt. water
- 1/2 Tbsp. cooking oil
- 8 oz. acini de pepe (a BB size pasta product)
- 2 (11 oz. each) cans mandarin oranges, drained
- 1 (20 oz.) can pineapple chunks, drained
- 1 (9 oz.) carton nondairy whipped topping
- 1/2 c. miniature marshmallows
- 1/2 c. coconut

Directions:
- Combine sugar, flour and salt; gradually stir in egg and pineapple juice.
- Cook over moderate heat, stirring until thickened.
- Add lemon juice.
- Cool to room temperature.
- Bring water to boiling point with salt according to directions on acini de pepe box.
- Add oil and cook acini de pepe only until tender but firm.
- Drain and rinse well with cold water.
- Combine egg mixture with acini de pepe, mixing lightly.
- Refrigerate overnight in an airtight container.
- The next morning, add remaining ingredients. Mix lightly but thoroughly.
- Refrigerate in airtight container until well chilled.
- Salad may be refrigerated for a week, if desired.

Mandarin Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/2 pt. sour cream
- 1 c. miniature marshmallows
- 1 can mandarin oranges, drained
- 1 (20 oz.) can chunk pineapple, drained
- 1/4 c. shredded coconut
- 2 or 3 bananas, sliced

Directions:
- Mix the sour cream, marshmallows and coconut.
- Use wooden spoon and stir in oranges and pineapple.
- Refrigerate overnight. Just before serving, add bananas.
- Serves 6.

Pea Salad

Ingredients:
- 4 cans sweet peas
- 6 to 8 hard-cooked eggs
- 4 heaping Tbsp. Miracle Whip
- 3 Tbsp. sugar
- vinegar

Directions:
- Drain peas.
- Mix Miracle Whip with sugar; add vinegar (enough to make very tart).
- Cut up eggs.
- Mix all ingredients together. Cover and cool.

Zesty Chicken Pot Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese, cubed
- 1/2 c. chicken broth
- 3 c. chopped chicken or turkey
- 2 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen mixed vegetables, thawed
- 2 envelopes Good Seasons salad dressing
- 1 (15 oz.) pkg. refrigerated pie crusts (2 crusts)

Directions:
- Cook cream cheese and broth in large saucepan on low heat until cheese is melted, stirring frequently with wire whisk. Stir in chicken, vegetables and salad dressing mixes. Spoon into 9-inch pie plate. Cover with 1 pie crust; seal and flute edge. Cut several slits to permit steam to escape. Cut remaining pie crust into decorative shapes; arrange on crust. Place pie plate on cookie sheet. Bake at 425° for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 8 servings.

Fruited Coleslaw

Ingredients:
- 1 qt. shredded cabbage
- 1 c. miniature marshmallows
- 1 can pineapple tidbits, drained
- 1 c. chopped apples
- 1/2 c. chopped celery
- Miracle Whip salad dressing

Directions:
- Combine cabbage, marshmallows, pineapple, apple, celery and enough salad dressing to moisten. Toss lightly and chill.

Cranberry Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 pkg. small or 1 pkg. large lemon jello or you can use another flavor
- 1 c. boiling water
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. cold water
- 2 whole oranges, ground (about 1/2 skin on)
- 2 c. fresh cranberries, ground
- 2 c. chopped apples, unpeeled
- 1 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Dissolve
- jello in hot water.
- Add sugar and stir until dissolved.
- Add cool water.
- Set in refrigerator to cool until thick
- (soft).
- Add ground fruits, nuts and liquids.
- Mix then pour into mold and refrigerate.

Taco Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. hamburger, browned and drained
- 2 cans kidney beans, drained
- 1 head lettuce, broken up
- tomatoes (as many as desired)
- 1 pkg. Doritos, broken up
- salt and pepper
- olives
- 8 oz. grated sharp cheese
- 1 bottle French dressing

Directions:
- Toss all ingredients together.

Pineapple Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 envelopes Knox gelatine
- 1 c. water
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Bring water, gelatine, sugar and pineapple to boil.
- Cook for five minutes.
- Remove from stove and while hot add cream cheese and cream.
- Stir until smooth.
- Add pecans.
- Pour into mold or decorative bowl.
- Chill until firm.

Dressing For Fresh Fruits

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. container plain low-fat yogurt
- 1/2 tsp. grated lime peel
- 1/4 c. milk
- 3 Tbsp. honey

Directions:
- In small bowl, combine all ingredients until smooth.
- Chill about 2 hours.
- Serve over fresh fruit salads.
- Yield: 1 1/4 cups.

Red Hot Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 small pkg. raspberry Jell-O
- 1 c. hot water
- 1/4 c. red hots
- 1 1/2 c. applesauce

Directions:
- Dissolve red hots in hot water and add Jell-O.	Blend thoroughly and cool.
- Add applesauce.
- Pour in loaf pan and jell.

Green Bean And Radish Salad In Sour Cream Vinaigrette

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. green beans, trimmed
- 3 Tbsp. red wine vinegar
- 6 Tbsp. olive oil
- 4 Tbsp. sour cream
- 2 c. thin sliced radishes (red and white)
- 1/2 c. minced scallions
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Bring plenty of lightly salted water to a boil.
- Add the beans and cook until just tender, about 6 or 7 minutes.
- Drain and run under cold water to stop further cooking.
- Transfer the beans to a serving bowl.
- Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon vinegar, sour cream and oil.
- Whisk the dressing until smooth.
- Season to taste with salt and pepper.
- Add the radishes, scallions and dressing to the beans. Toss the salad gently with 2 spoons.
- Let the salad marinate at room temperature for 2 hours before serving.
- Turn salad to lunch dish by adding smoked turkey, Swiss cheese or smoked ham, cut into julienne strips.

Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 12 medium potatoes
- 1 doz. eggs
- 2 c. Miracle Whip salad dressing
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- salt and pepper
- 1/2 tsp. celery seed
- 1 large onion

Directions:
- Cook the potatoes in their skins.
- Cool, peel and cut up in fine pieces.
- Cook the eggs and cool, peel and cut up.
- Chop up the peeled onion.
- Put all together.
- Sprinkle the salt, pepper and celery seed over them.
- Then mix the salad dressing, vinegar and sugar together.
- You may have to add more sugar and vinegar to make it taste real tart.
- Mix all together while potatoes and eggs are still warm.

St. Patrick'S Trader Vic Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 qt. greens
- 6 Tbsp. salad oil
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- salt and pepper
- 1/4 c. Parmesan cheese
- 1/2 c. crumbled Roquefort cheese
- 1 raw egg
- 1/2 c. lemon juice
- 2 c. croutons with garlic

Directions:
- Mix all but lettuce and croutons.
- Toss with greens and top with croutons.

Frozen Cranberry Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) carton Cool Whip
- 1 (16 oz.) can whole berry cranberry sauce
- 1 c. crushed pineapple
- 2 medium bananas, peeled and sliced

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and spoon into paper lined muffin cup and freeze.
- Remove from freezer a few minutes before serving. Makes 15 servings.

Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. dates
- 1/2 c. raisins
- 1 c. water
- fruit as desired

Directions:
- Cut up your favorite fruit into a bowl.
- Add chopped walnuts and shredded coconut, as desired.

Seasoned Brussels Sprouts Parmesan

Ingredients:
- 3 pkg. frozen brussels sprouts
- 2 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- salt
- 2 Tbsp. salad crunches, seasoned topping
- Parmesan cheese
- parsley flakes

Directions:
- In large saucepan, add brussels sprouts, salt and butter to 2 inches of water.
- Bring to boil, cover and cook until tender, about 15 to 20 minutes.
- Drain.
- Add salad crunches and parsley and sprinkle parmesan to cover sprouts.
- Serve warm.
- Serves 4 to 6.

Caramel Apple Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 Granny Smith or other green apples, diced
- 3 red apples, diced
- 6 (2.07 oz. each) pkg. chocolate-covered caramel peanut nougat bars, chopped
- 3 1/2 c. thawed nondairy whipped topping

Directions:
- Mix apples and candy until well blended.
- Gently stir in whipped topping.
- Refrigerate 1 hour or until ready to serve. Garnish with apple slices and additional chopped candy bars, if desired.

Vegetable Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can Shoepeg corn
- 1 can small green peas
- 1 can French green beans
- 1/2 c. chopped celery
- 1/4 oz. pimientos
- 1/4 c. chopped green bell peppers
- 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1/2 c. salad oil
- 1 c. sugar
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Drain corn, peas and beans.
- Then mix peppers, celery and pimientos with first mixture.
- Bring to boil the oil, vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper.
- Pour over vegetables; mix well.
- Chill and serve.
- Keeps for weeks.

Macaroni Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. elbow macaroni
- 2 small, boiled red potatoes
- 2 boiled eggs
- 1/8 cup chopped parsley
- 1/8 cup chopped red bell peper
- 8 oz. ranch dressing
- 8 oz. sour cream
- 1 Tbsp. freshly ground black pepper
- 1 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 tsp. onion powder

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and refrigerate until time to serve.

Summer Squash Pasta

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. summer squash
- 1 lb. zucchini
- 2 cloves garlic
- 1 large onion
- 1/2 Tbsp. crumbled Feta
- olive oil
- salt and pepper
- 1 lb. angel hair pasta

Directions:
- Cut zucchini and squash into fourths lengthwise, then into 1/2-inch sections crosswise.
- Dice onion; mince garlic.
- Fry onion in enough oil to keep it from sticking.
- Add garlic when onion is soft.
- Then add squash.
- Cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until mixture collapses and becomes soft.
- Remove from heat and add cheese, the salt and pepper to taste (cheese is quite salty).
- Serve over or mix into pasta adding more olive oil as needed.
- Serve with green salad if desired.

Hot Chicken Salad Casserole

Ingredients:
- 4 c. diced, cooked chicken
- 1 1/2 c celery, finely chopped
- 1 c toasted, slivered almonds
- 1 t salt
- 4 T grated onion
- 1 c green pepper, chopped
- 1 c mayonnaise
- 4 T chopped pimiento (optional)
- 4 T lemon juice
- 1-10 3/4 oz can cream of chicken soup, undiluted
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, chopped
- 2 c grated sharp cheese
- crushed potato chips for topping

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients except potato chips and cheese; blend well together.
- Spoon into a lightly greased 3 quart shallow casserole.
- Top with cheese.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Put sprinkling of potato chips over surface during last 10 minutes of baking.

Snicker Bar Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 apples
- 3 bananas
- 3 Snicker candy bars
- 1 (8 oz.) carton Cool Whip

Directions:
- Dice apples with peeling on.
- Slice bananas and the refrigerated candy bars into bite size pieces.
- Fold in Cool Whip.

Strawberry Jello Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 small pkg. strawberry Jell-O
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. frozen strawberries
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans
- 1 c. boiling water
- 1 pt. sour cream
- 3 mashed bananas

Directions:
- Dissolve Jell-O in hot water; add strawberries, bananas and nuts.
- Put 1/2 of mixture in glass bowl or mold and refrigerate until firm.
- Spread 1/2 of the sour cream on first mixture of Jell-O and pour remaining Jell-O mixture on top of sour cream. Chill again until firm.
- Spread the remaining sour cream on top. Better if made the day before.

Spaghetti Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. pkg. spaghetti
- 1 large bottle Zesty Italian dressing
- 1 bottle Salad Supreme seasoning mix
- 1 large green pepper
- 1 large onion
- 2 cucumbers
- 2 tomatoes

Directions:
- Boil spaghetti according to directions on package.
- Drain off hot water and rinse spaghetti in cold water 3 times.
- Add Zesty Italian dressing.
- Mix well.
- Add at least a half bottle of seasoning mix.
- Stir well.
- Cut up all vegetables and add them to spaghetti mixture.
- Store in refrigerator.
- Serve cold.

Torn Salad Dressing

Ingredients:
- 5 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. celery seed
- 2 tsp. prepared mustard
- 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. salad oil
- 1 tsp. onion
- 2 garlic cloves

Directions:
- Put all the ingredients into blender. Can add roquefort or bleu cheese.
- Keeps well.

Black Bean Salad

Ingredients:
- 8 to 10 oz. black beans
- 1 red pepper
- 1 green pepper
- 1 purple onion
- 1 small bag Shoe Peg corn, thawed

Directions:
- Soak beans overnight. Drain soaking liquid. Cook 1 hour. Rinse and chill beans.
- Mix all ingredients.
- Pour over with Italian dressing. Will keep several days.

Fresh Fruit Salad Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. orange juice
- 1/4 c. lemon juice
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 egg, beaten

Directions:
- Mix juices and sugar; stir in beaten egg.
- Cook in double boiler for 5 minutes until spoon is coated.
- Good on fruits and melons.

Mexican Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. hamburger
- 1 bell pepper, chopped
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 Tbsp. chili powder
- salt to taste
- 2 lb. Velveeta cheese
- 1 can diced Ro-Tel
- 1 (11 oz.) bag Fritos
- 1 head lettuce, shredded
- 2 large tomatoes, chopped

Directions:
- Saute hamburger, pepper and onion together until meat is brown. Add seasonings and keep mixture warm.
- Melt cheese and Ro-Tel together.
- Keep warm.
- In individual salad bowls, layer Fritos, meat, lettuce and tomatoes.
- Cover with cheese sauce.

Artichoke Rice Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 1/2 c. raw rice
- 7 c. water
- 2 (14 oz.) cans artichoke hearts, drained and quartered
- 8 to 10 green onions, sliced
- 3/4 c. oil
- 3/4 c. vinegar
- 5 chicken bouillon cubes
- 2 medium green peppers, chopped
- 20 to 30 stuffed green olives, sliced once
- 1 to 2 tsp. curry powder
- 1 c. mayonnaise

Directions:
- Marinate artichoke hearts in vinegar and oil for 4 to 6 hours; drain and reserve liquid.

Cranberry Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 box cherry Jell-O
- 1 c. hot water
- 1 qt. fresh cranberries
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 c. nuts
- 1 small can crushed pineapple
- 1 Tbsp. ReaLemon juice

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together (except drain and save pineapple juice).
- Beat together pineapple juice, water and lemon juice. Then stir into Jell-O until dissolved.
- Chill until set.

Heavenly Hash Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 c. miniature marshmallows
- 1 c. Mandarin oranges
- 1 c. pineapple tidbits
- 1 c. coconut
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 c. fruit cocktail

Directions:
- Drain
- liquid from fruits.
- Combine all ingredients and refrigerate 3 to 4 hours before serving.

Taco Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 large onion
- 1 pkg. taco seasoning mix (any brand)
- 1 large head lettuce
- 2 large tomatoes
- 1 large pkg. grated Cheddar cheese
- 1 large bag Doritos
- 1 medium size bottle Italian salad dressing

Directions:
- Brown ground beef; drain.
- Chill enough so it does not wilt lettuce.
- Chop onion and tomatoes.
- Cut lettuce to salad size.
- In large bowl, combine lettuce, onion, tomatoes and taco mix.
- Add beef.
- Crunch up the Doritos and add to mixture.
- Pour dressing over salad just before serving.

Nacho Cheese Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. pkg. Velveeta cheese
- 1 (8 oz.) jar salsa
- 1 lb. hamburger
- 1/2 tsp. Tabasco sauce

Directions:
- Cut cheese into cubes in a saucepan; add salsa to keep cheese from sticking.
- Brown hamburger; drain.
- Salt and pepper to taste. Add Tabasco sauce.
- Combine hamburger and cheese.
- Excellent dip for nachos or taco salad.

Sherbet Jello Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. black raspberry Jello
- 3 c. boiling water or ginger ale
- 1 pt. raspberry sherbet
- 1 (9 oz.) container Cool Whip

Directions:
- Dissolve Jello in water, add sherbet.
- Stir until melted. Let set until jelly like.
- Gently stir in Cool Whip.
- Let set until firm.

Strawberry Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 small pkg. strawberry Jell-O
- 2 c. boiling water
- 1 large pkg. frozen strawberries
- 2 mashed bananas
- 1/2 c. pecans
- 1/2 pt. sour cream

Directions:
- Dissolve Jell-O with boiling water.
- Add rest of ingredients. Place in refrigerator to set.
- Serve with Cool Whip.

Coleslaw And Salad Dressing

Ingredients:
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. yellow mustard
- 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- 1 pt. mayonnaise

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients except mayonnaise. Beat well with mixer.
- Cook until thick. Remove pan from stove and add mayonnaise. Beat well and cool.

Poppy Seed Dressing

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- 2 Tbsp. poppy seed
- 1 tsp. celery seed
- 1 Tbsp. grated onion
- 1/4 tsp. black pepper
- 2/3 c. vinegar
- 2 c. salad oil

Directions:
- Blend all ingredients except oil. Drip in oil very slowly; blend well.
- Store in jar in refrigerator.

Classic Lobster Seafood Salad(4 Servings)  

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. imitation lobster chunks
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1 stalk celery, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. chopped onion
- lettuce leaves

Directions:
- Mix lobster, mayonnaise, celery and onion.
- Serve on bed of lettuce.

Salad Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 pt. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. ketchup
- 2 tsp. vinegar
- 1 tsp. garlic salt
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp. paprika

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Stir until well blended.
- Store in refrigerator in covered container.

Easy Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can peach pie filling
- 1 carton frozen whole strawberries
- 3 bananas, sliced

Directions:
- Combine strawberries and pie filling. Chill for several hours. Add bananas just before serving.

Lime-Pineapple Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. lime Jell-O
- 1 c. hot water
- 1/4 c. pineapple juice
- 1 c. crushed pineapple, drained
- 2 1/2 tsp. horseradish
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. cottage cheese

Directions:
- Dissolve Jell-O in hot water.
- Chill.
- Add remaining ingredients and let set.

Corn Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can Shoe Peg corn
- 1/2 c. chopped bell pepper
- 1/2 medium onion, chopped
- 1 large tomato, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- salt and pepper to taste
- cucumber, peeled and sliced
- celery seed

Directions:
- Drain corn and mix all ingredients together. Vinegar, oil and a dash of sugar can be added for a tasteful salad.

Steamed Fish

Ingredients:
- 1 kumu or mullet (1 lb.)
- 2 slices fresh ginger
- 2 Tbsp. green onion, finely chopped
- 2 Tbsp. shoyu
- 1/4 tsp. ajinomoto
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. salad oil
- Chinese parsley

Directions:
- Place fish and ginger in pot of boiling water (water should cover fish).
- Turn flame off and cover with tight fitting lid. Let stand for 30 minutes or until done.
- Place fish on platter. Sprinkle with finely chopped green onion.

Seafood Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. crabmeat
- 1 lb. large shrimp, cooked and peeled
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 2 Tbsp. French dressing
- 1/2 c. chili sauce
- 2 Tbsp. horseradish
- 1 Tbsp. minced onion
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire
- 1 tsp. seasoned salt
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- pepper to taste
- lettuce wedges
- tomato wedges

Directions:
- Combine crabmeat and shrimp.
- Combine mayonnaise, French dressing, chili sauce, horseradish, onion, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce and seasonings.
- Pour over crabmeat and shrimp.
- Cover and chill 2 to 3 hours.
- Serve on lettuce and garnish with tomato wedges.

Poppy Seed Dressing

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/3 c. vinegar
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. onion juice
- 1 c. salad oil
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. poppy seed

Directions:
- Mix first 4 ingredients in blender or electric mixer.
- Add oil slowly.
- Stir in poppy seeds.
- Serve over fresh fruit or finely shredded red cabbage and seedless fresh grapes.

Scrambled Eggs, Spanish Style

Ingredients:
- oil or salad oil
- 1 medium onion
- 1/4 tsp. dried thyme
- 1/4 tsp. hot pepper sauce
- 8 large eggs
- 2 medium size green pepper
- 1 small garlic clove
- 3 medium tomatoes
- salt
- parsley for garnish

Directions:
- Slice green peppers; slice onion thinly.
- In 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat in tablespoon of hot olive or salad oil, cook green peppers, onion, garlic, dried thyme leaves and 1/2 teaspoon salt until vegetables are tender-crisp; add tomatoes and hot pepper sauce.
- Cook 2 to 3 minutes until tomatoes are softened.
- Spoon mixture onto warm large platter to keep warm.

Cherry Pineapple Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
- 1 can cherry pie filling
- 1 tsp. lemon juice
- 1 can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1 large bowl Cool Whip

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.

Avocado Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. lemon jello
- 1 c. hot water
- 1 small can tomato sauce
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- Cut up some celery, green onions, and big chunks of avocados, Guess at the amount.

Directions:
- Dissolve jello in hot water.
- Add tomato sauce and vinegar. When partially set, add avocados, onion and celery.

Party Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk
- 1 (9 oz.) container Cool Whip
- 1 can cherry pie filling
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 c. pecans

Directions:
- Mix milk and Cool Whip; refrigerate for one hour.
- Add cherry pie filling and crushed pineapple.
- Mix well; add pecans and refrigerate until serving time.

Peach Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can peach pie filling
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk
- 1 (20 oz.) can pineapple (crushed), drained
- 1 (8 oz.) carton Cool Whip
- 1 c. coconut
- 1 c. pecans, chopped

Directions:
- Mix and chill at least 4 hours.

Yum Yum Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 head lettuce
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 3 oz. slivered almonds, toasted
- 10 strips bacon, crisp
- 4 Tbsp. sesame seeds
- 1/2 can chow mein noodles
- 4 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 c. canola oil or toasted sesame oil
- toasted almonds
- sesame seeds

Directions:
- Mix first 6 ingredients together.
- Add remaining ingredients and put the noodles right before serving.

Turnip Salad

Ingredients:
- 4 medium-size turnips
- 1 or 2 hard-boiled eggs
- salt
- pinch of oregano, if desired
- vinegar
- salad oil

Directions:
- Boil turnips and peel; cut in slices.
- Add chopped onion, salt, oregano, vinegar and oil.
- Toss gently and top with sliced eggs.

April'S Blueberry Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 pkg. Concord grape jello
- 1 c. boiling water
- 1 c. cold water
- 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple
- 1 can blueberry pie filling

Directions:
- Boil 1 cup water and add 2 packages of jello, then add 1 cup cold water.
- Drain pineapple and mix with jello and add blueberry pie filling.
- Chill until jelled.

Beef Balls

Ingredients:
- 1 c. chopped roast beef, cut fine and cooked
- 2 Tbsp. chopped Mario salad olives with pimiento strips
- 1/2 c. mayo
- 1 c. pecans, chopped fine
- 1 tsp. salt
- paprika

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients and chill overnight.
- Roll into balls. Place on serving tray.
- Sprinkle with paprika.
- Makes 2 dozen.

Orange Buttermilk Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple (undrained)
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. orange-flavored gelatin
- 2 c. buttermilk
- 1 (8 oz.) carton frozen whipped topping, thawed

Directions:
- In a saucepan, bring pineapple to a boil.
- Remove from heat; add gelatin and stir to dissolve.
- Add buttermilk and mix well. Cool to room temperature.
- Fold in whipped topping.
- Pour into an 11 x 7 x 2-inch dish.
- Refrigerate several hours or overnight. Cut into squares.
- Yields 12 servings.

Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 5 to 6 lb. potatoes
- 1 onion
- 5 celery ribs
- 1 small block Velveeta cheese
- 1 1/2 c. pickle relish
- 2 c. mayonnaise
- 2 c. Miracle Whip salad dressing
- 3 Tbsp. mustard
- 2 tsp. celery salt
- 1 tsp. garlic powder
- salt to taste
- 1 tsp. white pepper
- paprika for garnish

Directions:
- Wash and boil potatoes in skins until tender.
- Drain off water and allow to cool.
- Peel and dice potatoes to desired size.
- Peel and dice onion.
- (Dab eyes with dishcloth.) Wash and dice celery. Dice Velveeta into small pieces.
- (Eat a couple of pieces.)
- Place all ingredients into a large bowl and mix thoroughly.
- If too dry, add more mayonnaise.
- Transfer all to a nice clean bowl and garnish with paprika and green olives with tail lights.
- Serves from1 to 12, depending on appetite.

Orange Pineapple Salad

Ingredients:
- 24 oz. cottage cheese
- 2 large boxes orange jello
- 2 small cans mandarin oranges
- 2 (2 oz.) cans crushed pineapple
- large Cool Whip
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts
- 1 jar candied cherries
- 1 small pkg. miniature marshmallows

Directions:
- Mix jello according to package directions.
- Let set in refrigerator for about 30 minutes.
- Remove and mix all other ingredients with it.
- Return to refrigerator and let it set all night.
- When ready to serve, top with pineapple slices with a cherry in center.

Tuna Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can drained tuna
- 1 chopped cucumber
- 1 chopped tomato
- 1 chopped dill pickle
- 2 Tbsp. mayonnaise

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Chill and serve.

Congealed Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 1 can strawberry pie filling
- 1 small can pecans, chopped
- 1 (8 oz.) Cool Whip
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together; put in a jello mold or just a bowl.
- Refrigerate overnight.

Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken, cut up and skinned
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 sleeve Ritz crackers
- 1 (8 oz.) sour cream
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 stick margarine

Directions:
- Boil the chicken until done. Debone and place in a large bowl. Add both cans of soup and sour cream; mix well.
- Put in a casserole dish. Crumble up the entire sleeve of crackers and sprinkle on top of the chicken mixture.
- Melt 1 stick of margarine and pour over the top of the crackers.
- Bake in a 350° preheated oven until bubbly. Throw together your favorite green salad, add some rolls and you have a quick meal.
- Cream of celery or onion soup may be used as the soup.

Pear Marmalade

Ingredients:
- 3 qt. cooked pears
- 4 pkg. orange-pineapple jello
- 2 cans pineapple

Directions:
- Cook pears like salad pears, then mash them. Add jello and pineapple. Cook over low heat about 30 minutes, then put in jars.

Creme Sherry Wine Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. yellow cake mix
- 1 pkg. instant vanilla pudding
- 4 eggs
- 3/4 c. salad oil
- 3/4 c. creme sherry
- 1 pkg. sliced walnuts or pecans

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Mix cake mix, pudding, eggs, salad oil, sherry and walnuts or pecans.
- Grease and lightly flour Bundt pan. Pour in pan and bake at least 45 minutes.

Russian Cream Salad

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1 Knox brand gelatine
- 1/2 c. water
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. Cool Whip
- fresh strawberries

Directions:
- Double these ingredients for one jello mold.

Edith'S Pineapple Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can chunk pineapple
- 2 c. miniature marshmallows
- 1 banana
- 1/2 c. cheese chunks
- 1/2 c. pineapple juice
- 2/3 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 eggs, beaten

Directions:
- Add first 4 ingredients and refrigerate.
- Can also add a container of whipped cream.

Strawberry Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 large boxes strawberry jello
- 1 1/2 c. boiling water
- 2 large pkg. strawberries
- 3 mashed bananas
- 1 can crushed pineapple, drained
- 2 small cartons sour cream

Directions:
- Combine strawberry jello with 1 1/2 cups boiling water; mix. Add strawberries and bananas.
- Add pineapple; mix and layer with sour cream.

Eight Layer Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/2 head lettuce
- 1/2 c. chopped celery
- 1/2 c. chopped onions (optional)
- 1/2 c. chopped green peppers
- 1 (16 oz.) can peas, drained
- 2 c. Miracle Whip
- 1/2 lb. bacon, fried and crumbled
- 2 c. shredded cheese

Directions:
- Layer in 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Top with shredded cheese.

Creamy Coleslaw

Ingredients:
- 12 lb. shredded cabbage
- 9 carrots, shredded
- 3 c. chopped bell peppers
- 3 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 c. canned milk
- 1 1/2 c. apple vinegar
- 6 c. Miracle Whip salad dressing

Directions:
- Mix together and refrigerate.
- Reduce 1/3 to 1/4 for family.

Quick Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. Jell-O (any flavor)
- 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple, well drained
- 1 pt. cottage cheese
- 8 oz. Cool Whip

Directions:
- In a large bowl, prepare 1 package of Jell-O as directions indicate.
- Add drained pineapple.
- Sprinkle remaining package of Jell-O over mixture.
- Stir in cottage cheese and Cool Whip.
- Blend until smooth.
- Refrigerate until set in 11 3/4 x 7 1/2 x 1 3/4-inch pan.

Cornbread Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 c. cornbread
- 1 lb. bacon, fried and crumbled up
- 2 onions
- 2 tomatoes
- 2 green peppers
- 1/2 c. sweet pickles, chopped

Directions:
- Chop the onions, tomatoes, green peppers and pickles and mix with the cornbread and bacon.
- Add pickle juice and mayonnaise to taste for the dressing.

Taco Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 1 large can kidney beans
- 2 pkg. taco seasoning
- 4 tomatoes, chopped
- 8 oz. grated Cheddar
- 1 bottle Western dressing
- 1 bag tortilla chips, broken
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 head lettuce (bite size pieces)

Directions:
- Brown ground beef; drain.
- Add beans with liquid.
- Add salt and taco seasoning to taste.
- Simmer 10 minutes.
- Drain off all liquids and cool.
- Chill before serving.
- Gently toss the lettuce, tomatoes, dressing, cheese and chips together.
- Stir in meat and bean mixture.

Frozen Pink Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 4 c. miniature marshmallows
- 1 c. pecans, chopped
- 1 can fruit cocktail, drained
- 1 pint whipping cream, whipped well
- red food color

Directions:
- Thoroughly mix cream cheese, mayonnaise and sugar together. Add marshmallows, pecans and fruit cocktail.
- Add desired amount of red food color to the whipped cream.
- Fold in colored whipped cream.
- Freeze in thin layer in serving dish.
- Cut into small squares before serving.
- Serve frozen or only partially thawed. (This was served on a restaurant buffet on Sundays.)

Mexican Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 medium head lettuce, shredded
- 4 tomatoes, diced
- 1 diced onion
- 1 lb. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1 small can kidney beans, drained
- 1 lb. hamburger
- 1 pkg. taco seasoning mix
- 1/2 c. water
- 1/2 bag nacho corn chips
- 1 pkg. Good Seasons cheese garlic dressing, mixed with oil and vinegar

Directions:
- Mix the first five ingredients together.
- Brown hamburger. Drain and mix with taco seasoning mix and 1/2 cup water.
- Simmer 5 minutes.
- Let cool, then add to salad.

Asparagus Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can asparagus soup (undiluted)
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. lemon Jell-O
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1/2 c. cold water
- 1/2 c. real mayonnaise
- 2/3 c. chopped green pepper
- 2/3 c. chopped celery
- 1 Tbsp. grated onion

Directions:
- Heat soup to boiling.
- Remove from heat and add Jell-O.
- Stir until dissolved.
- Add cream cheese and mix until well blended. Stir in remaining ingredients.
- Chill.

Low-Fat Cucumber Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. onions
- 1 pt. cottage cheese (fat free)
- 1 c. cucumbers, diced
- 2 boxes lime Jell-O (sugar-free)
- 2 c. water (hot)

Directions:
- Dissolve Jell-O in water; let slightly thicken.
- Add rest of ingredients.
- Store in refrigerator.

Broccoli Supreme Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. (about 4 1/2 to 5 c.) broccoli flowerets, small
- 1/2 c. raisins
- 1/2 c. roasted sunflower seeds
- 1 c. fat-free mayonnaise
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/4 c. granulated sugar

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Cranberry Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. cherry gelatin
- 1 1/2 c. boiling water
- 2 tsp. grated orange rind (optional)
- 1 (16 oz.) can whole cranberry sauce
- 1 (8 oz.) can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1/2 c. finely chopped celery
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- In a saucepan, dissolve the gelatin in boiling water and stir in the orange rind and cranberry sauce. Refrigerate the mixture until it is thickened. Remove from the refrigerator and stir in the pineapple, celery and pecans. Pour the mixture into a lightly oiled 1 1/2-quart mold. Refrigerate the salad until it is firm. Unmold the salad on the lettuce leaves. Serves 10 to 12.

Mucho Nacho Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 4 tomatoes
- 8 oz. shredded cheese
- 1 pt. medium hot salsa
- 1 large bag nacho cheese chips
- 1 head lettuce
- 1 medium onion
- 8 oz. creamy Ranch dressing

Directions:
- Brown ground beef and cool.
- Chop lettuce, tomatoes and onion. Mix, then add shredded Cheddar cheese and creamy Ranch dressing. Sprinkle more cheese on top.
- Serve with nacho chips.
- May be crushed and added to each individual salad or served on the side. Use salsa to suit your taste.
- This makes a very large main salad.

Carrot Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. salt
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 (6 oz.) can thawed orange juice
- 3/4 c. salad oil
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract
- 2 1/2 c. shredded carrots
- 1/2 c. golden raisins
- 1 c. chopped pecans
- 1 small shredded cooking apple

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Grease and flour a 10-inch Bundt pan. In a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, brown sugar, baking soda, cinnamon and salt.
- In a small bowl, beat eggs slightly; stir in orange juice, salad oil and vanilla.
- Stir egg mixture, carrots, raisins, nuts and apples into flour mixture just until flour is moistened.
- Pour batter into pan.
- Bake 50 to 55 minutes.
- Cool in pan 10 minutes; remove cake from pan and cool completely.

Dip For Fresh Vegetables

Ingredients:
- fresh vegetables, cut in bite size pieces
- 16 oz. container sour cream or plain yogurt
- 1 pkg. Ranch salad dressing

Directions:
- Mix sour cream or yogurt with salad dressing.
- Serve with veggies.

Flag Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 pkg. (3 oz.) Jell-O (2 red raspberry and 1 black raspberry)
- 1 c. milk
- 1 envelope unflavored gelatin
- 1/2 c. water
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. nuts
- 1 (15 oz.) can wild blueberries

Directions:
- Dissolve red raspberry Jell-O in 3 1/2 cups water.
- Chill until firm.
- Use 9 x 13-inch pan.

Dream Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (9 oz.) pkg. Cool Whip
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. orange Jell-O
- 1 large can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 pt. cottage cheese
- 1 c. small marshmallows
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Sprinkle Jell-O over Cool Whip; mix well.
- Stir in remaining ingredients; chill.

Cajun Jambalaya

Ingredients:
- 5 to 6 chicken thighs
- 1 1/2 lb. Andouille sausage
- 4 c. chopped onion
- 3 chopped bell peppers
- 1 chopped red or yellow pepper
- 1 Tbsp. minced garlic
- 3 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper
- 2 bay leaves
- 2 1/2 c. white rice
- 1/2 c. cubed, smoked ham
- 3 1/2 c. water or stock

Directions:
- Brown sausage in large, deep pot.
- Remove and add chicken. Cook chicken until done.
- Remove.
- Throw in vegetables and ham and cook until tender.
- Add spices.
- Add sausage and debone chicken. Stir thoroughly.
- Add water to cover.
- Bring to boil; turn down and cover.
- Cook about 20 minutes until rice is done.
- Stir occasionally to avoid sticking.
- Serve with salad and garlic bread.
- A Louisiana favorite!

Cold Cucumber Salad

Ingredients:
- 7 c. sliced cucumber
- 1 c. sliced sweet bell pepper
- 1 c. vinegar
- 1 tsp. celery seed
- 1 c. sliced onions
- 1 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Mix vinegar, salt, celery seed and sugar until dissolved. Pour over rest and put in covered dish.
- Place in refrigerator. Wait 24 hours before eating.
- Good for a summer cook out.

Tomato French Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 (10 3/4 oz.) can tomato soup
- 1/2 c. salad oil
- 1/4 c. vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard

Directions:
- Mix in electric blender.
- Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

"A B C" Sandwich

Ingredients:
- 2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1 medium apple, finely chopped
- 3/4 c. salad dressing or mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. finely chopped walnuts
- 12 slices bread, toasted and buttered
- 12 bacon strips, cooked
- 6 hard-cooked eggs, sliced
- 6 tomato slices (optional)

Directions:
- In a bowl, combine cheese, apple, salad dressing and walnuts. Spread on 6 slices of bread and place 2 slices of bacon on each. Cover with egg slices.
- Top with tomatoes, if desired, and remaining slices of bread.

Pretty Patio Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. sour cream
- 1 tsp. lemon juice
- 1/2 tsp. celery salt
- 1 tsp. poppy seed
- 1 tsp. prepared mustard
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients and mix well.

Watergate Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans or walnuts
- 1 c. miniature marshmallows
- 1 (9 oz.) nondairy whipped topping
- 1 (3 1/2 oz.) box instant pistachio pudding mix

Directions:
- Drain pineapple and reserve juice.
- Place pudding mix in large bowl.
- Add about 4 tablespoons of the pineapple juice to make a soft paste.
- Mix well.
- Add drained pineapple, whipped topping, marshmallows and chopped nuts.
- Mix well until mixture is fluffy and increases in volume.
- Refrigerate until chilled.

Wild Rice Rose(Serve With Lamb Or Chicken)  

Ingredients:
- 1 c. wild rice
- 1 c. grated sharp American cheese
- 1 c. sliced mushrooms
- 1 c. chopped olives
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 c. hot water
- 1/2 c. salad oil (although I use 1/4)
- 1 c. canned tomatoes
- 1/2 tsp. garlic salt

Directions:
- Soak rice overnight; drain.
- Wash and drain.
- Mix with remaining ingredients.
- Place in buttered 2-quart casserole dish. Cover and bake for 1 hour at 350°.
- Serves 4 to 6.

Apple Jello Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 c. applesauce
- 6 oz. lemon Jell-O
- 12 oz. can lemon/lime pop
- 1 tsp. orange peel
- 1/4 c. orange juice
- 1 c. chopped apple (use a red one and leave skin on)
- 2 Tbsp. chopped walnuts

Directions:
- In a saucepan, heat applesauce until it bubbles.
- Stir in Jell-O and cook until dissolved.
- Remove and cool, then stir in pop, orange juice and peel.
- Chill until partially set, then stir in apples and nuts.
- Chill until set firm.

Quick Fix Oyster Crackers

Ingredients:
- 2 (12 oz.) pkg. oyster crackers
- 1 pkg. Hidden Valley original salad dressing mix
- 2 Tbsp. dill weed
- 1 c. corn oil

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients. Garlic powder to taste. Make a day ahead.

Taco Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 head lettuce, shredded
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 1 can pinto beans, drained
- 1 boiled egg, chopped
- 1 c. medium-sharp Cheddar, shredded
- 1 avocado, diced
- 1 tomato, chopped
- 1 bag regular size Fritos

Directions:
- Mix all but Fritos in large bowl.
- Chill, then make Meat Sauce:

Summer Ginger Ale Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. lemon jello
- 1 c. boiling water
- 6 oz. can frozen lemonade concentrate
- 1 pt. ginger ale
- 1 c. cantaloupe balls
- 1 c. watermelon balls
- 1 c. seedless grapes
- 2 sliced bananas

Directions:
- Dissolve jello in boiling water.
- Add lemonade concentrate and stir to dissolve.
- Add ginger ale.
- Chill until thick, but not set.
- Fold in remaining ingredients.
- Pour into 2 1/2-quart mold. Chill until firm.
- Makes 8 to 10 servings.

Shortbread Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 pkg. instant vanilla pudding (3 oz.)
- 2 c. buttermilk
- 2 cans mandarin oranges (small)
- 1 (12 or 16 oz.) Cool Whip
- 1 pkg. shortbread cookies

Directions:
- Mix pudding and buttermilk.
- Add oranges (I drain 1 can), Cool Whip (I use 16 ounces) and shortbread cookies.
- Refrigerate.

Lasagna

Ingredients:
- 1 tsp. salad oil
- 1/4 c. minced onion
- 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1 clove sliced garlic
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. oregano
- 2 Tbsp. snipped parsley
- 1 (No. 303) can tomatoes
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 1/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese
- 1/4 lb. lasagna noodles
- 1/2 lb. thin sliced Mozzarella
- 1/2 lb. Ricotta cheese

Directions:
- In skillet, saute onion.
- Add meat and cook until done. Mash garlic
- with
- salt.
- Add
- to
- meat	with pepper, oregano, parsley, tomatoes,	tomato	sauce
- and 1 tablespoon Parmesan. Simmer, covered, 30 minutes.

Caesar'S Salad Dressing

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. olive oil
- 3 Tbsp. red wine vinegar
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- 3/4 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 large or 2 small garlic cloves, crushed

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients in a jar and shake well.
- Store in refrigerator.

Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (20 oz.) can pineapple chunks
- 1 small pkg. vanilla pudding and pie filling (not instant)
- 2 large oranges, peeled, divided and cut up
- 2 large bananas, sliced
- 1 can fruit cocktail (reserve 2 c. juice)

Directions:
- Drain juice from pineapple and fruit cocktail.
- Reserve to use with pudding.
- Combine juice and pudding in small saucepan; bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
- Mixture should thicken and become clear.
- Cool to room temperature.
- In large bowl, gently combine the pineapple chunks, oranges and fruit cocktail.
- Pour pudding mixture over fruit and toss to coat fruit.
- Refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours.
- When ready to serve, add bananas and gently combine. Serve immediately.
- Bananas may darken after a while.

Pineapple Rice Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Minute rice
- 1 1/2 c. water
- 2 boxes Dream Whip or 1 (8 oz.) Cool Whip
- 1 large pkg. cream cheese
- 1/3 c. sugar
- 1 can drained, crushed pineapple

Directions:
- Cooked cup of rice is added to all other ingredients.
- Mix well.
- Serve.

Sauerkraut Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 large can sauerkraut
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. celery, chopped (optional)
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 small jar pimentos
- 1/2 c. green onion, chopped

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and enjoy.

Corn Bread Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 pans corn bread
- 1 bell pepper, chopped
- 1 medium onion (purple) or 1 small bunch fresh onions and tops, chopped
- 2 to 3 tomatoes, diced
- 10 pieces bacon, cooked and crumbled, or bacon bits
- 1 c. Miracle Whip
- 1 c. cubed sharp Cheddar cheese (optional), or shredded

Directions:
- Cook corn bread to package directions. Cool. It's better if kept for 24 hours, then crumbled. Add all vegetables. Cool in refrigerator about 1 hour. Stir in Miracle Whip. Add cheese.

Shrimp Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 cans shrimp
- 1 can tomato soup
- 8 oz. cream cheese
- 1 envelope Knox gelatine
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 3/4 c. finely chopped celery
- 3/4 c. finely chopped onion

Directions:
- Warm tomato soup; add gelatine to soften.
- Add other ingredients.
- Allow to set up in refrigerator.

Beef Stroganoff

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream of celery soup
- 1 small can mushrooms
- 1/2 c. salad dressing
- 1 green pepper
- 1 onion
- 1 large steak

Directions:
- Brown steak with green pepper and onion and cut into small bite-size pieces.
- Combine remaining ingredients.
- Pour over egg noodles or rice.

Macaroni Lunch

Ingredients:
- 1 small pkg. elbow macaroni, cooked and drained
- 1 1/2 lb. pan-fry sausage
- 1 large can (28 oz.) tomatoes
- 1 small can (8 oz.) tomato sauce and 1 can water*
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tsp. canola oil
- 1/2 tsp. celery seed

Directions:
- Pan fry sausage into crumbled pieces and drain on paper towels.
- In a large boiler, bring to boil tomatoes, tomato sauce, water (add more or less water according to your liking), salt and pepper, oil and celery seed.
- Add sausage and macaroni.
- Stir well, turn off, place on lid and leave covered 5 minutes.
- Serve with crackers and salad or coleslaw.
